article: My relationship with my father has an enormous impact on my life. Overall, I _ a very great sense of love and well-being when I remember Dad. He was _ to providing the best he could for us. When _ , I was a bit in awe of Dad. I loved him dearly but I was also a little afraid of him; I was afraid of displeasing him because I knew he could get angry and shout and this _ me. Dad would scoop us up and hug and _ us. He was loud and larger, in happiness as well as when _ . He had a great sense of humor. _ he was not a great reader, I do remember him reading Tom Sharpe books and _ raucously  to himself in the process. Dad was enormously _ of his family. He praised us to anyone who would listen and _ in front of us. "I can take my kids anywhere; they're always well _ ." As an adult, I would turn to Dad _ advice and support and he was always there. The main _ I recall is that whatever age I was, there was always a strong, powerful hug and kiss _ I saw him. It is over seven years since Dad died. I still _ his voice if I imagine certain things. But even without hearing his voice, the most _ thing is that he is still with me every day of my life. I do no have identical _ to him, however, I know that from him, I learned strong values. Dad taught me to value and respect money, to be _ with it and not to want too much or be too _ for material things ...
